TITLE: Referencing Alpine Base Image in Dockerfile
DESCRIPTION: Examples of how to reference the Alpine base image in a Dockerfile using different versions and tags. This allows developers to choose the specific Alpine version and update frequency for their development environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/images/blob/main/src/base-alpine/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Dockerfile
CODE:
```
FROM mcr.microsoft.com/devcontainers/base:alpine
FROM mcr.microsoft.com/devcontainers/base:alpine-3.21
FROM mcr.microsoft.com/devcontainers/base:alpine-3.20
FROM mcr.microsoft.com/devcontainers/base:alpine-3.19
FROM mcr.microsoft.com/devcontainers/base:alpine-3.18
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Script Execution in Dockerfile with Cleanup
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to copy a script into the container, execute it, and remove it all in a single layer to maintain a clean image.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/images/blob/main/docs/TIPS.md#2025-04-17_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: dockerfile
CODE:
```
COPY ./my-script.sh /tmp/my-script.sh
RUN bash /tmp/my-script.sh \
    && rm -f /tmp/my-script.sh
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing a Different Python Version with Conda
DESCRIPTION: These Bash commands illustrate how to install a specific Python version (3.6) in a Miniconda environment, followed by reinstalling pipx to manage utilities after the Python upgrade.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/images/blob/main/src/miniconda/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
conda install python=3.6
pip install --no-cache-dir pipx
pipx uninstall pipx
pipx reinstall-all
```

TITLE: Setting Up ASP.NET Core HTTPS Development Certificate in Bash
DESCRIPTION: Bash script that generates an ASP.NET Core HTTPS development certificate, exports it to PEM format, and adds it to the container's trust store, ensuring the certificate is available for development use.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/images/blob/main/src/dotnet/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
#!/usr/bin/env bash

# Change ownership of the .dotnet directory to the vscode user (to avoid permission errors)
sudo chown -R vscode:vscode /home/vscode/.dotnet

# If there is no development certificate, this command will generate a new one
dotnet dev-certs https

# Export the ASP.NET Core HTTPS development certificate to a PEM file
sudo -E dotnet dev-certs https --export-path /usr/local/share/ca-certificates/dotnet-dev-cert.crt --format pem

# Add the PEM file to the trust store
sudo update-ca-certificates
```

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:

```

TITLE: Configuring Named Volume for ASP.NET Core HTTPS Dev Certificate in devcontainer.json
DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration for devcontainer.json that adds a named volume to preserve the ASP.NET Core HTTPS development certificate between container rebuilds and references a lifecycle script for certificate setup.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/images/blob/main/src/dotnet/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json

        "source": "x509stores",

```

TITLE: Multi-Python Version Dockerfile Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Dockerfile configuration for installing multiple Python versions in the same container using Ubuntu as base.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/images/blob/main/src/python/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: dockerfile
CODE:
```
FROM ubuntu:jammy
ARG PYTHON_PACKAGES="python3.13 python3.12 python3 python3-pip python3-venv"
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install --no-install-recommends -yq software-properties-common \
     && add-apt-repository ppa:deadsnakes/ppa && apt-get update \
     && apt-get install -yq --no-install-recommends ${PYTHON_PACKAGES} \
     && pip3 install --no-cache-dir --upgrade pip setuptools wheel
```

TITLE: Global Pip Installation Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Dockerfile configuration to enable global pip installations without sudo for the vscode user.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/images/blob/main/src/python/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: dockerfile
CODE:
```
ENV PIP_TARGET=/usr/local/pip-global
ENV PYTHONPATH=${PIP_TARGET}:${PYTHONPATH}
ENV PATH=${PIP_TARGET}/bin:${PATH}
RUN if ! cat /etc/group | grep -e "^pip-global:" > /dev/null 2>&1; then groupadd -r pip-global; fi \
    && usermod -a -G pip-global vscode \
    && umask 0002 && mkdir -p ${PIP_TARGET} \
    && chown :pip-global ${PIP_TARGET} \
    && ( [ ! -f "/etc/profile.d/00-restore-env.sh" ] || sed -i -e "s/export PATH=/export PATH=\/usr\/local\/pip-global:/" /etc/profile.d/00-restore-env.sh )
```

TITLE: Configuring a C++ Project with CMake
DESCRIPTION: A complete CMake configuration file that sets up a C++ project named 'test-project'. It defines the minimum CMake version, enables testing capabilities, adds an executable from a main.cpp file, and configures CPack variables for packaging the project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/images/blob/main/src/cpp/test-project/CMakeLists.txt#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: CMake
CODE:
```
cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.0.0)
project(test-project VERSION 0.1.0)

include(CTest)
enable_testing()

add_executable(test-project main.cpp)

set(CPACK_PROJECT_NAME ${PROJECT_NAME})
set(CPACK_PROJECT_VERSION ${PROJECT_VERSION})
include(CPack)
```

TITLE: Setting Variant-Specific Build Arguments in JSONC
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the build.variantBuildArgs property to specify different build arguments for each variant. This is useful when different variants require different configuration settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/images/blob/main/build/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: jsonc
CODE:
```
"build": {
    "variantBuildArgs": {
        "17-bullseye": {
            "TARGET_JAVA_VERSION": "17",
            "BASE_IMAGE_VERSION_CODENAME": "bullseye"
        },
        "11-bullseye": {
            "TARGET_JAVA_VERSION": "11",
            "BASE_IMAGE_VERSION_CODENAME": "bullseye"
        },
        "17-buster": {
            "TARGET_JAVA_VERSION": "17",
            "BASE_IMAGE_VERSION_CODENAME": "buster"
        },
        "11-buster": {
            "JAVA_IMAGE_TAG": "11",
            "BASE_IMAGE_VERSION_CODENAME": "buster"
        }
    },
    //...
}
```

TITLE: Configuring Other Dependencies in JSONC
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the 'other' property to handle scenarios not covered by other dependency types. This example configures kubectl with custom version command and download URL.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/images/blob/main/build/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_16

LANGUAGE: jsonc
CODE:
```
"other": {
    "kubectl": {
        "versionCommand": "kubectl version --client | grep -oP 'GitVersion\\s*:\\s*\\"v\\K[0-9]+\\.[0-9]+\\.[0-9]+'",
        "path": "/usr/local/bin",
        "downloadUrl": "https://github.com/kubernetes/kubectl"
    }
}
```

TITLE: Installing Python Version in Dockerfile
DESCRIPTION: This Dockerfile snippet installs a different Python version (3.6) and updates pipx to ensure utilities are properly managed within the container.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/images/blob/main/src/miniconda/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: Dockerfile
CODE:
```
RUN conda install -y python=3.6 \
    && pip install --no-cache-dir pipx \
    && pipx uninstall pipx \
    && pipx reinstall-all
```

TITLE: Configuring Language Dependencies in JSONC
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the 'languages' property to specify language runtimes and their configurations. This is useful for adding entries to the 'Languages' section of history markdown files.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/images/blob/main/build/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_17

LANGUAGE: jsonc
CODE:
```
"languages": {
    "Java": {
        "cgIgnore": true,
        "versionCommand": "ls /opt/java | grep -oE '[0-9]+\\.[0-9]+\\.[0-9]+'",
        "path": "/opt/java/<version>"
    },
    ".NET": {
        "cgIgnore": true,
        "versionCommand": "ls /opt/dotnet | grep -oE '[0-9]+\\.[0-9]+\\.[0-9]+'",
        "path": "/home/codespaces/.dotnet<br />/opt/dotnet"
    },
    "Ruby": {
        "cgIgnore": true,
        "versionCommand": "ls /opt/ruby | grep -oE '[0-9]+\\.[0-9]+\\.[0-9]+'",
        "path": "/opt/ruby/<version>"
    }
}
```

TITLE: Configuring Variant Tags for Image Builds in JSONC
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the build.variantTags property to specify different tags for each variant in the variants property. This allows for more granular control over image tagging.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/images/blob/main/build/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: jsonc
CODE:
```
"variants": ["buster", "bullseye"],
"build": {
    "latest": "bullseye",
    "tags": [
        "base:${VARIANT}"
    ],
    "variantTags": {
        "bullseye": [
            "base:debian-11",
            "base:debian11",
            "base:debian",
        ],
        "buster": [
            "base:debian-10",
            "base:debian10"
        ]
    },
    //...
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: DevContainer Image Documentation Template using Handlebars
DESCRIPTION: A markdown template that uses Handlebars syntax to generate documentation for DevContainer images. The template includes dynamic image links, version information, source repository references, and optional variant listings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/images/blob/main/build/assets/release-notes-header.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
# [{{image}}](https://github.com/{{repository}}/tree/main/src/{{image}})
{{#if annotation}}
{{{annotation}}}
{{/if}}

**Image version:** {{version}}

**Source release/branch:** [{{release}}](https://github.com/{{repository}}/tree/{{release}}/src/{{image}})

{{#if hasVariants}}
**Image variations:**
{{#each variants}}
- [{{this}}](#variant-{{anchor this}})
{{/each}}

{{/if}}
```

    "virtualenv"
],

],

    "typescript"
]
```

TITLE: Updating Conda Environment from environment.yml in Dockerfile
DESCRIPTION: This Dockerfile command checks for an environment.yml file and updates the Conda environment accordingly. It removes the temporary files afterward.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/images/blob/main/src/miniconda/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: Dockerfile
CODE:
```
RUN if [ -f "/tmp/conda-tmp/environment.yml" ]; then /opt/conda/bin/conda env update -n base -f /tmp/conda-tmp/environment.yml; fi \
    && rm -rf /tmp/conda-tmp
```

DESCRIPTION: Example of combining apt-get commands in a single RUN statement to install git while cleaning up package lists and temporary files to minimize image size.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/images/blob/main/docs/TIPS.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: dockerfile
CODE:
```

```

LANGUAGE: dockerfile
CODE:
```
RUN apt-get update && export DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive \
    && apt-get -y install autoconf automake libtool m4 autoconf-archive \
    && apt-get autoremove -y && apt-get clean -y && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*
```

**Digest:** sha256:919988086928ce0e1eea7eed4678ca1f9f1c4bed0a19177d8b562ae4a7fad522

**Tags:**
```
mcr.microsoft.com/devcontainers/jekyll:0.1.20-2.7-buster
mcr.microsoft.com/devcontainers/jekyll:0.1.20-buster
```
> *To keep up to date, we recommend using partial version numbers. Use the major version number to get all non-breaking changes (e.g. `0-`) or major and minor to only get fixes (e.g. `0.200-`).*

**Linux distribution:** Debian GNU/Linux 10 (buster)

**Architectures:** linux/amd64

**Available (non-root) user:** vscode
```

**Tags:**

> *To keep up to date, we recommend using partial version numbers. Use the major version number to get all non-breaking changes (e.g. `0-`) or major and minor to only get fixes (e.g. `0.200-`).*

**Linux distribution:** Debian GNU/Linux 11 (bullseye)

**Architectures:** linux/amd64, linux/arm64

**Available (non-root) user:** vscode

**Languages and runtimes**

| Language / runtime | Version | Path |
|--------------------|---------|------|
| [Go](https://golang.org/dl) | 1.17.3 | /usr/local/go |
